Text:
www.hokshop.com/online_bestellen_994/WOII-In-Woord-en-Beeld-deel-8.html

Description

The Second World War in Word & Image is a unique eight-part series on the entire history of World War II.

The idea behind the war in words and pictures is a targeted selection of key events, a picture of the progress of World War II. We made it in tribute to the more than fifty million people who have died. But even more so in the belief that the world must be constantly reminded of universal human rights. Everyone is equal regardless of skin color, gender, religion or belief. Because only from that idea, it is possible to think that all those men, women and children died not for nothing.

PART 8 - The end of World War II.

2 DVDs [#12 & #13 of 16] with 7 fascinating documentaries on the history of World War II. The documentaries are from collections including: A & E Television Networks, Evangelical Broadcasting, Discovery Channel and BBC.
         The Nuremberg trials
         The bombing of Germany
         The last days of WWII
         The Berlin airlift
         The first battle of the cold war
         General George C. Marshall
         Soldier and Statesman
This is supposed to be DVD 12, so I may not have given the correct description above. Sorry.

Part 6 of 8, DVDs 11 & 12, should include:
Westerbork: Camp of hope and despair
The last seven months of Anne Frank
Eichmann
Why the failed assassination attempt on Hitler
Escapes in WW2
The French Resistance
Resistance to a Jewish transport

@ asc11

I dont understand your comments anymore, or I didn't understand them anyway.
The uploaded files are what the description says. Maybe you are thinking about another serie but this one is all right.

Good luck downloading them and watching the documentaries


Mad_Parrot

OK, I will try to be more understandable.
The video.google.nl URL which you gave is only a short promotional video for the 16-DVD series. It sends the viewer to www.hokshop.com .

There, at the URL which I gave, the series is for sale. You can buy it as a complete set. It has also been packaged as eight 2-DVD units, so you can ALSO buy any single 2-DVD unit.

DVDs 11 and 12 together would be the sixth unit in the series of eight units, and, according to hokshop, they contain what I showed in the comment that begins "Part 6 of 8, DVDs 11 & 12".

Anyone who goes to the hokshop web page needs to use the selection box at the right-hand side to choose one of the eight units.

I hope this clears things up.
